寶典.definition: canonical text; treasury (i.e. book of treasured wisdom)

寶刀不老.definition: lit. a good sword always remains sharp (idiom); fig. (of one's skills etc) to be as good as ever; the old man still has it

寶刀未老.definition: treasure knife does not age (idiom); old but still vigorous

寶劍.definition: (double-edged) sword (esp. a valuable or famous one); CL:把[ba3]

寶嘉康蒂.definition: Pocahontas (c. 1595-1617), native American noted for her association with the colony of Jamestown, Virginia

寶地.definition: blessed land; a place rich in beauty or natural resources etc; (term of respect) your place

寶坻.definition: Baodi rural district in Tianjin 天津[Tian1 jin1]

寶坻區.definition: Baodi rural district in Tianjin 天津[Tian1 jin1]

寶塔區.definition: Baota or Pagoda district of Yan'an city 延安市[Yan2 an1 shi4], Shaanxi

寶塔菜.definition: Chinese artichoke (Stachys affinis), perennial plant with an edible rhizome

寶媽.definition: a mom (mother of a young child)

寶安.definition: Bao'an district of Shenzhen City 深圳市, Guangdong

寶安區.definition: Bao'an district of Shenzhen City 深圳市, Guangdong

寶山.definition: Baoshang District of Shanghai; Baoshan District of Shuangyashan city 雙鴨山|双鸭山[Shuang1 ya1 shan1], Heilongjiang; Baoshan or Paoshan township in Hsinchu County 新竹縣|新竹县[Xin1 zhu2 Xian4], northwest Taiwan

寶山區.definition: Baoshang district of Shanghai; Baoshan district of Shuangyashan city 雙鴨山|双鸭山[Shuang1 ya1 shan1], Heilongjiang

寶山鄉.definition: Baoshan or Paoshan township in Hsinchu County 新竹縣|新竹县[Xin1 zhu2 Xian4], northwest Taiwan

寶庫.definition: treasure-house; treasury; treasure-trove (often fig., book of treasured wisdom)

寶應.definition: Baoying County in Yangzhou 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1], Jiangsu

寶應縣.definition: Baoying County in Yangzhou 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1], Jiangsu

寶武鋼鐵.definition: Baowu, the world's largest steel maker, resulting from the merger of Baosteel 寶鋼集團|宝钢集团[Bao3 gang1 Ji2 tuan2] and Wuhan Iron and Steel 武漢鋼鐵|武汉钢铁[Wu3 han4 Gang1 tie3] in 2016

寶清.definition: Baoqing county in Shuangyashan 雙鴨山|双鸭山[Shuang1 ya1 shan1], Heilongjiang

寶清縣.definition: Baoqing county in Shuangyashan 雙鴨山|双鸭山[Shuang1 ya1 shan1], Heilongjiang

寶爸.definition: a dad (father of a young child)

寶瓶座.definition: Aquarius (constellation and sign of the zodiac); also called 水瓶座

寶興.definition: Baoxing County in Ya'an 雅安[Ya3 an1], Sichuan

寶興歌鶇.definition: (bird species of China) Chinese thrush (Turdus mupinensis)

寶興縣.definition: Baoxing County in Ya'an 雅安[Ya3 an1], Sichuan

寶興鶥雀.definition: (bird species of China) rufous-tailed babbler (Moupinia poecilotis)

寶船.definition: Chinese treasure ship, a type of large sailing ship in the fleet of Ming dynasty admiral Zheng He 鄭和|郑和[Zheng4 He2]

寶萊塢.definition: Bollywood (film industry based in Mumbai, India)

寶葫蘆.definition: magic gourd, granting your every wish

寶葫蘆的秘密.pinyin: bǎo hú lú de mì mì
寶葫蘆的秘密.definition: Secret of the Magic Gourd (1958), prize-winning children's fairy tale by Zhang Tianyi 張天翼|张天翼[Zhang1 Tian1 yi4]

寶蓋.definition: name of the "roof" radical 宀[mian2] (Kangxi radical 40)

寶藏.definition: precious mineral deposits; hidden treasure; (fig.) treasure; (Buddhism) the treasure of Buddha's law

寶血.definition: (Christianity) Precious Blood (of Jesus Christ); Blood of Christ

寶誌.definition: Baozhi, or Pao-chih, Chinese monk (418–514), also known as 保誌|保志 or 誌公|志公

寶豐.definition: Baofeng county in Pingdingshan 平頂山|平顶山[Ping2 ding3 shan1], Henan

寶豐縣.definition: Baofeng county in Pingdingshan 平頂山|平顶山[Ping2 ding3 shan1], Henan

寶貝.definition: treasured object; treasure; darling; baby; cowry; good-for-nothing or queer character

寶貝兒.definition: erhua variant of 寶貝|宝贝[bao3 bei4]

寶貝疙瘩.definition: (of a child) apple of one's eye

寶貴.definition: valuable; precious; to value; to treasure; to set store by

寶鋼.definition: Baosteel, Chinese steel maker formed in a 1998 merger, then merged to form Baowu 寶武鋼鐵|宝武钢铁[Bao3 wu3 Gang1 tie3] in 2016

寶雞.definition: see 寶雞市|宝鸡市[Bao3ji1 Shi4]

寶雞市.definition: Baoji, prefecture-level city in Shaanxi Province 陝西省|陕西省[Shan3xi1 Sheng3]

寶馬香車.definition: precious horses and magnificent carriage (idiom); rich family with extravagant lifestyle; ostentatious display of luxury
